0qfmk8t4asfidpd5d3uqb3ng8g.name: Deloitte Consulting - InsightStudio's Studio Jam
0qfmk8t4asfidpd5d3uqb3ng8g.description:
Join us for Deloitte InsightStudio's Studio Jam, a collaborative exercise to help design a solution to solve a business issue. This event is open to those interested in the Developer, Designer, or Data Scientist positions with the InsightStudio.

Come prepared for a fun team activity and to network with current InsightStudio employees. 

Pizza will be served.

Speaking at This Event:
Tim Schuster
Specialist Master
As a Specialist Master in Deloitte’s InsightStudio, Timothy has 9+ years of professional experience supporting clients across both commercial and federal sectors. Timothy’s area of expertise includes business intelligence architecture and development, analytics & data visualization, and information management. Timothy leads the business intelligence development capabilities for S&O Analytics - InsightStudio.

713165aki5rdvv63q8qd8pt898.name: Facebook Open House
713165aki5rdvv63q8qd8pt898.description:
Connect with Facebook at Open House instead of waiting in line at the TOC! We'll be showcasing a variety of open technical opportunities exclusively to CMU students on September 10th and will have representation from multiple areas. Don't forget to RSVP at the link below!

https://facebookatcmu2019.splashthat.com/

48m23libs8goke9c58og6b17eb.name: Industry Secrets w/ Swipe to Unlock
48m23libs8goke9c58og6b17eb.description:
RSVP: tinyurl.com/swipetounlock
CMU Business Technology Group is pleased to host Neel Mehta and Adi Agashe, influential Product Managers from Google and Microsoft, for an interactive presentation based on their #1 Amazon Bestseller Swipe to Unlock.

Neel and Adi will break down emerging technology trends and dissect novel business strategies used in the industry. They're looking forward to equipping you with an effective framework for evaluating when and how to successfully enter new markets.

Following the talk, our speakers will stay for a Meet and Greet. You'll be able to speak with them one-on-one and enter our raffle for a chance to win a free copy of Swipe to Unlock!

7ku8o3t0avh14iu8lac0sitrrc.name: Adobe Tech Talk
7ku8o3t0avh14iu8lac0sitrrc.description:
At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We also give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers!

Learn more about Adobe by registering for the Adobe Tech Talk at Carnegie Mellon University and hear from one of our own Adobe Data Scientists who also happens to be a CMU alum!

Arvind Narayanamurthy is a Data Scientist on the Adobe Digital Insights team where he works closely with the Digital Strategy Group (DSG) to scientifically build and deliver business insights to Adobe's enterprise customers on their digital performance relative to similar businesses. On a daily basis he helps the team ingest new data sets, stitch and calibrate data across various sources and build prescriptive analysis or predictive models.

Want to learn more about internships or university grad opportunities at Adobe? Be sure to RSVP to this event and apply to the opportunities posted on Handshake!

**Food will be served

4f60ckl4jg0trpfftl7c3b02rr.name: Mastercard CMU UX Coffee chats 1
4f60ckl4jg0trpfftl7c3b02rr.description:
Doodle poll for signups: https://doodle.com/poll/vuighwvs5ucgsyxs

Hi all,

My name is Tim and I’m a BHCI alum from the class of 2017. I’m now working as a UX designer at Mastercard Data & Services (formerly known as Applied Predictive Technologies or APT) in the Washington DC area. I wanted to let you all know that our company will be sending a few designers to campus on September 16th and we want to connect with the BHCI class. We’ll be hosting a series of informal coffee chats on campus throughout the day. Come stop by and learn about working at Mastercard D&S, get some critique on your portfolio, or talk about anything else on your mind! We’re also hiring full time and intern UX designers and will be accepting resumes if you’d like to submit one. We look forward to meeting you all!

2746f6pq4p3om7dc6aej4li439.name: Samsara Tech Talk
2746f6pq4p3om7dc6aej4li439.description:
(Offering both full time & internship for design! https://www.samsara.com/careers#open-positions)
Samsara is the leader in Industrial IoT. Our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy.
Samsara’s portfolio of complete Internet of Things (“IoT”) solutions combine hardware, software, and cloud to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations. We serve over 10,000 customers across diverse sizes and industries, from transportation and logistics to field services, food production, energy, construction, local governments, and manufacturing.
From mechanical engineering to hardware to software, we take pride in building an end-to-end experience that our customers love. Some highlights:
• Established leadership (previously led $1.2 billion acquisition of Meraki to Cisco)
• CEO Sanjit Biswas named 2018 Top CEO by Glassdoor
• VP Aidan Madigan-Curtis named a 2019 Top 50 Women in Technology
• #3 on LinkedIn's Top Startups of 2019
• Series F, $6.3B valuation
• Modern software stack (Go, React, Typescript, GraphQL)
• 100 billion data points collected annually
• 1000+ boba teas consumed monthly
About the tech talk
Every year, more than 4 million car accidents are caused by driver distraction. In this talk, we'll look at how computer vision and machine learning can be applied on vehicle dash cameras to prevent such accidents by augmenting drivers' ability to stay attentive.
For more information, check out samsara.com/careers. If you have any questions, please email campus-recruiting@samsara.com.
We look forward to meeting you!

3nkv2al2qnqqgoq4mqt8nb2jku.name: A Day in the Life of a Capital One Designer, Engineer, & Product Manager
3nkv2al2qnqqgoq4mqt8nb2jku.description:
Join a Capital One designer, engineer, & product manager to learn what a day in the life of these unique, but interconnected roles is like.

During this interactive info session and associate panel, you'll learn more about working in digital design, technology, and product management at Capital One. This is a great chance to learn more about our exciting rotation and intern programs, as well as our company, culture, and more.

Register here: https://bit.ly/2k04SJE

Food, refreshments, & swag provided!

_70s42d9j8ksk2ba674p3eb9k88r3iba28l2kcb9.name: Google - Product inclusion talk
_70s42d9j8ksk2ba674p3eb9k88r3iba28l2kcb9.description:
At Google we are working hard to ensure that our differences aren’t
simply acknowledged, but celebrated. Join us and learn about why
this is so important to Google, and how this ultimately drives
innovation with a keynote by Annie Jean-Baptiste, Google’s Head of
Product Inclusion, Research & Activation. Lunch will be served! 

RSVP: goo.gle/googleday

_6d130da264pk2ba6852jeb9k64r48b9p69232ba.name: Bank of America Design Case study & networking
_6d130da264pk2ba6852jeb9k64r48b9p69232ba.description:
You’re invited to our Bank of America Experience Design Interactive

Case Study & Networking Event at CMU!
Bank of America, we’ll match your drive and ambition
to where you can make a real impact.

As one of the world’s largest financial institutions, our global
connections allow you to create a career on your own terms.

You’re invited to our Bank of America Experience Design Interactive Case Study & Networking
Event at CMU on Wednesday, October 16th

from 6:30pm-8:00pm to learn about our 2020

Experience Design businesses!

_8ook6hhi64s3eb9o6t334b9k6d13aba284qj4ba.name: Studio Arts College International - Florence Tabling
_8ook6hhi64s3eb9o6t334b9k6d13aba284qj4ba.description:
Studio Art Centers International: Florence (SACI) : Earn your MA, MFA, or Post- Bac in a U.S.-accredited program that gives you direct access to one of the greatest artistic and cultural centers of Europe. SACI is the oldest and most prestigious American art school in Florence with courses fully accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD). Emphasizing direct, hands-on experience through on-site work and travel, SACI’s master degree and certificate programs immerse you in the vibrant and historic art community of Florence, offering a transformative graduate experience abroad that provides you with the tools and methods to make your own contribution and influence positive change.

Programs include:
· MA Art History
· MFA Studio Art
· MFA Photography
· MFA Communication Design
· Post-Bac Studio Art
· Post-Bac Conservation

7p7lcp3gvnoqfsn06spclnvi7g.name: Archi - AECM & MSSD Networking Symposium
7p7lcp3gvnoqfsn06spclnvi7g.description:
Presented in collaboration between the School of Architecture and the CPDC, AECM and MSSD students are invited to participate in this in-depth workshop symposium focused on the job search, preparation to go into the workforce, and practicing networking in the most efficient and holistic ways. Covering topics such as elevator pitch creation, proper job search etiquette, and best practices, this symposium will engage you in the process of knowledge-building and sharing to be prepared to job search prior to your graduation.

Agenda of Events:
12:00-1:30pm: Split lunch roundtable discussion with alumni-
MSSD: Alumnus Anna Rosenblum, (BArch 2013, MSSD 2013). Anna is employed at evolve in Pittsburgh, PA.
AECM: Alumnus Carolyn Caranante, (BArch 2008, MSAECM 2009). Carolyn is currently a Project Manager for Tishman Realty & Construction in NYC. She was a Project Manager on One World Trade Center.

2:00-2:30pm: Elevator Pitch Creation

2:30-2:45pm: Practicing Your Pitch

2:45-3:30pm: The job search

3:30-3:45pm: Break

3:45-4:30pm: Best practices and etiquette

4:30-5:00pm: Alexis McCune Secosky: OIE/MyVisaJobs/International searches

After this full day of learning, join us for an evening of networking with invited employers interested in networking and sharing job opportunities at their companies/firms.

20paifjjd1haicoe2our6m7r9s.name: Archi - AECM & MSSD Networking Night
20paifjjd1haicoe2our6m7r9s.description:
After a day of learning the tricks of networking and tips around job searching, join the School of Architecture and the CPDC for an evening of networking with various employers such as (TBA). Dress is business casual, and please bring resumes. Light refreshments will be served.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/369220

1kkmmqq55oic2ah7m8d6nsgrni.name: Spotify @ CMU Tech Talk + Mixer
1kkmmqq55oic2ah7m8d6nsgrni.description:
Calling all CMU Tech Rockstars!

Think you've got what it takes to shape the future of the audio industry as a Spotify intern?

Come rock out at our Tech Talk + Mixer and meet our Band Members (aka employees)! The event playlist will consist of a discussion on what #LifeAtSpotify is like and the cool stuff our Band Members are working on! We’ll also provide info on our Summer Internship Program.

Join us at CMU on Tuesday, October, 29th at 6 PM. Space is limited so RSVP now and we will send a confirmation with location details closer to the date.

#JoinTheBand

43lflpdho5r3pq8ae05127c138.name: Product Design for Mobility Presented by Ford IT
43lflpdho5r3pq8ae05127c138.description: Join representatives from Information Technology at Ford for a technical presentation on product design for mobility experiences.

5ekj47l85unpoe3mc25mlvpdh3.name: Vivo Info Session
5ekj47l85unpoe3mc25mlvpdh3.description:
vivo is a global company that specializes in the mobile Internet intelligent terminal and AI terminal technology R&D and application. Supported by its R&D centers and manufacturing bases in China (Dongguan, Shenzhen, Nanjing, Beijing, Hangzhou, and Chongqing), India, Indonesia, and the United States (San Diego), the company has progressively entered the fields of smartphones and mobile Internet with sales in China, India, Southeast Asia (Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Thailand, Myanmar, the Philippines, and Bangladesh), Russia, etc.

vivo develops dynamic and stylish products for passionate, energetic young people. We focus on creating smartphones that provide customers with the ultimate experience in both mobile photography and Hi-Fi audio. Apart from smartphones, Vivo also develops various apps and internet tools which are seamlessly integrated into our products. In the future Vivo’s goal is to create a complete mobile internet ecosystem, comprehensively satisfying all user needs.
5ekj47l85unpoe3mc25mlvpdh3.location: Cohon University Center, Danforth Conference Room, 2nd Floor

3r8otggklfr4blu13setbrvg23.name: Roundtable Q&A with Activision: Game Design
3r8otggklfr4blu13setbrvg23.description: Join Activision for an informal roundtable discussion on what it takes to make it in game design and what it's like to work for one of the most prolific gaming companies in the world. Dress is casual, no resume required.

_6p23gh2469132b9n6p1kab9k70okab9o8oo4cb9.name: Capital One  - Digital Design & Product Management
_6p23gh2469132b9n6p1kab9k70okab9o8oo4cb9.description:
At Capital One, we don’t only think big things—we do big things. We were the first company to develop and offer mass customization and personalization of credit card products, and we have been innovating relentlessly ever since.

Today, we are a nationally recognized brand, a top 10 bank, and a scientific laboratory on a journey to become a leading high-tech company and digital innovator touching over 65 million customer accounts. Founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One has grown to $22 billion in revenue in just over 20 years.

Join Capital One digital designers and product managers for an informational session and panel on Wednesday, 10/2. This is a great chance to hear about our exciting design and product management rotation and internship programs, as well as our company, culture, and more.

Food, refreshments, & swag provided!

14phe8025ss05oi4nftu31tn1f.name: TAIT Towers Information Session for All Majors
14phe8025ss05oi4nftu31tn1f.description:
TAIT will be holding an information session for all majors on Tuesday, November 12th from 5-6pm in the Wells Video Studio in the Purnell Center. They are looking for students with skillsets and capabilities such as:

Staging-Engineering-Fabrication-Automation-Mechanical Design-Structural Design-Controls Design-Automated Rigging-Robotics-Integration-Performer Flying-Software

They also have career opportunities such as:

Designers-Engineers-Project Managers-Fabricators-Technicians-Welders-Painters-Machinists

TAIT is the World Market Leader in designing, constructing and delivering the finest live event solutions in the world.

Whether it’s creating awe-inspiring spectaculars, complex touring stages, theater engineering solutions, brand activations or cruise ship installations, TAIT delivers world-class solutions for live experiences. With its proprietary entertainment automation platform, custom-made products, and creative engineering, TAIT’s cutting-edge offerings continue to advance industry standards and exceed client expectations. As a global network of over 600 employees in 12 office locations, TAIT has worked on projects in over 30 countries, all 7 continents and even outer space.

TAIT’s diverse group of clients include Taylor Swift, Cirque Du Soleil, The Metropolitan Opera House, NASA, National Geographic, Beyoncé and The Olympics.
